ideas.title: Biometric authentication
ideas.description: Use biometric data (fingerprint, face recognition, etc.) to authenticate users instead of passwords.

pros: Enhanced security as biometric data is unique to each individual.
Convenient and user-friendly as users don't need to remember passwords.
Difficult to replicate or fake biometric data.
cons: Requires specialized hardware (e.g., fingerprint scanner, camera) for biometric data collection.
Privacy concerns regarding the storage and usage of biometric data.

ideas.title: Password manager applications
ideas.description: Encourage the use of password manager applications that securely store and autofill passwords.

Potential vulnerability if the password manager application is compromised.

ideas.reason: 2FA requires users to provide an additional verification method along with their password.
pros: Enhanced security by combining something the user knows (password) with something they have (e.g., SMS code, authenticator app).
Reduces the risk of unauthorized access even if the password is compromised.
cons: Can be slightly inconvenient for users due to the additional step in the login process.
Relies on the availability and security of the second factor (e.g., mobile phone).

ideas.title: Passwordless authentication
ideas.description: Implement passwordless authentication methods such as email magic links or SMS codes.
ideas.reason: Passwordless authentication eliminates the need for users to remember passwords.
pros: Simplifies the login process as users don't need to remember passwords.
Reduces the risk of password-related issues (e.g., forgotten passwords, weak passwords).
cons: Relies on the security of the email or phone number used for authentication.
Potential inconvenience if the user doesn't have access to their email or phone.

cons: Security questions can be guessed or researched by attackers.
